title: node
description: A node in the node hierarchy.  Nodes can reference meshes, cameras, lights, or skins.

camera.description: The id (JSON property name) of the camera referenced by this node.  A node will have either the camera, light, meshes, or instanceSkin property defined.

children.description: The ids (JSON property name) of this node's children.

joint.description: id used when this node is a joint in a skin.

light.description: The id (JSON property name) of the light referenced by this node.  A node will have either the camera, light, meshes, or instanceSkin property defined.

matrix.description: A floating-point 4x4 transformation matrix stored in column-major order.  A node will have either a matrix property defined or rotation, scale, and translation properties defined.  If none are provided, the transform is the identity.  WebGL: see uniformMatrix4fv with the transpose parameter equal to false.

meshes.description: The ids (JSON property name) of the meshes in this node.  Multiple meshes are allowed so each can share the same transform matrix.  A node will have either the camera, light, meshes, or instanceSkin property defined.

name.description: The user-defined name of this node.  This is not necessarily unique among nodes.

rotation.description: The node's quaternion rotation.  A node will have either a matrix property defined or rotation, scale, and translation properties defined.  If none are provided, the transform is the identity.

scale.description: The node's non-uniform scale.  A node will have either a matrix property defined or rotation, scale, and translation properties defined.  If none are provided, the transform is the identity.

translation.description: The node's translation.  A node will have either a matrix property defined or rotation, scale, and translation properties defined.  If none are provided, the transform is the identity.
